title: Woman holding baby threatens to blow up church in front of horrified worshippers
text:

Horrifying footage shows a woman carrying a baby in one arm brandish a gun as she stormed a church.

Minutes before it happened, Anna Conkey had threatened to 'blow up' the place of worship.

The clip, showing the woman carrying her 10-month-old baby, was released by the San Diego Police Department in California.

Conkey is accused of making a false report of a bomb, child abuse and making criminal threats, which she denies.

She was tackled by parishioners before anyone was hurt, and the gun was reportedly not loaded.

(Image: NBC4i)

(Image: NBC4i)

Pastor Ben Weisen, who was giving an Easter Sunday service when it happened, told a preliminary trial, NBC 4i reports: "She said 'you don’t know what it means to be willing to die'.

"She had a baby and a gun and we had a pretty good feeling that she was going to get shot and maybe some of our people were going to get shot."

He is seen in the video telling worshippers to "get down and pray".

(Image: NBC4i)

(Image: NBC4i)

Weisen continued: "I thought, first I’m pretty sure that’s a real gun and then I thought, OK there’s something that looks like a laser and I know this would keep people a lot calmer so I’m just gonna say it’s a taser out loud."

Navy veteran Conkey had a history of disrupting church services, it is claimed.

It happened on April 21, five minutes after she messaged NBC news - where she had previously been an intern - to tip them off.

(Image: NBC4i)

The email said: "There's a woman claiming to be the Messiah, saying she was sent to blow up the foundation of the Church — she's got a gun and a child is involved.

"The address is 4350 Mount Everest Blvd San Diego, CA 92117. There are about 70 people in the auditorium of the school where the church service is held."

(Image: NBC4i)

She had previously posted videos on YouTube claiming a "great deception" was taking place in churches and synagogues.

Following the incident her two children, aged five and 10 months, were taken into protective custody.
description: Anna Conkey stormed the service in San Diego, California, on Easter Sunday, a court was told
